intro: Haplolophium rodriguesii, commonly known as Rodrigues' hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
